channel.title: Posts on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on A Hugo website

item.title: R语言学习笔记
item.description: 1.数据转化为‘Tidy Data’ 读入数据并设置标题： clean <- read.csv('D:\\R\\R_workd\\clean.txt',header = FALSE,col.names = c('age','height','gender')) 去除‘height’列的*： gsub('*','',clean$height,fixed = TRUE) ## [1] "6.0" "5.9" "5.7" "-9999" 将数据类型转换成num： clean$height <- readr::parse_number(clean$height) 将‘height’中的-9999替换成NA： # 针对单个数据替换 clean$height[which(clean$height==-9999)] <- NA # 读入数据时批量替换 clean2 <- read.csv('D:\\R\\R_workd\\clean.txt',na.strings = -9999,header = FALSE,col.names = c('age','height','gender')) ’gender’格式统一： # 考虑到’gender‘列中有NA，应该先把NA位置识别出 clean$gender[which(clean$gender==' NA')] <- NA loc.na <- is.na(clean$gender) # 规范男女性别格式 clean$gender <- ifelse(clean$gender%in%c(' M','male','Man'),'male','female') # 保持NA仍输入为NA clean$gender[loc.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
